description: Waterproofing Level 15,250 and 16,350 of the Logette #1, Lachine Canal National Historic Site
full_summary:
---

**Tender Title: Waterproofing Level 15,250 and 16,350 of the Logette #1, Lachine Canal National Historic Site**

**Reference Number: cb-219-11223223**
**Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0061/A**
**Publication Date: 2023-11-01**
**Tender Closing Date: 2023-11-22T14:00:00**

**Opportunity Overview:**
---

Parks Canada Agency invites bids from qualified contractors for the waterproofing of the circular section of the building of logette 1 of the Canal-de-Lachine, level 15,250 and 16,350.

**Scope of Work:**

* Demolish the existing waterproofing system and dismantle metal structures (e.g., step, riser, support (stringer) and floor);
* Remove and dispose of all existing waterproofing components;
* Prepare the area for new waterproofing installation;
* Install a new waterproofing system, including all required accessories.

**Bid Submission and Response Instructions:**

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Bidders must submit their bids via fax or email, as indicated in the solicitation document. Bids submitted in-person or via courier will not be accepted.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Bids submitted directly to the Contracting Authority or to any other email address will not be accepted.
* The only acceptable facsimile for responses to bid solicitations is 1-855-983-1808.
* Bidders must provide a valid phone number for verification purposes.

**Technical Requirements and Visits to the Work Site:**

* Bidders are responsible for ensuring that their proposals meet all requirements set out in the solicitation document.
* An optional site visit is scheduled for November 14, 2023, at 10:00 AM local time. Interested bidders must notify the Contracting Authority of their intended attendance by November 10, 2023, at 4:00 PM.

**Eligibility and Pre-qualification:**

* Bidders must provide proof of pre-qualification from the Government of Canada's Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) immediately after award.

**Post-Award Process:**

* Upon the awarding of a contract, the successful bidder will be required to complete the required documents and submit to a site
